meanings.definition: To give a particular tone or character to something.
meanings.sent1: She is toning her voice to sound more confident.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys toning his drawings with bright colors.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about toning down his humor for a serious event.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness is toning the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The music toning the emotions of the listeners.

meanings.definition: The process of improving muscle tone through exercise.
meanings.sent1: Regular workouts help in toning muscles effectively.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a difference in her body's toning after starting yoga.
meanings.sent3: The gym instructor made toning exercises fun with upbeat music.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to toning his muscles paid off during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The toning of his arms was evident after weeks of training.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting the color or shade of a photograph or image.
meanings.sent1: She is skilled in toning photographs to enhance their beauty.
meanings.sent2: The toning of the picture brought out the details in the background.
meanings.sent3: The artist used toning to create a vintage look in the image.
meanings.sent4: Toning the colors of the painting made it more vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The toning of the photo added a warm glow to the scene.
